explain: Orlando City, a Major League Soccer (MLS) side, has shown interest in acquiring Manchester United's Javier Hernandez, who has struggled to make an impact on loan at Real Madrid. The move would potentially generate commercial appeal for the Florida-based team, coached by Adrian Heath.
Hernandez is valuable for Orlando City as a commercial draw since he has a huge potential in attracting audiences and generating revenue for the franchise.
This aspect mentions 6 additional clubs, beyond Orlando City, that are interested in Javier Hernandez. These clubs are Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, and Inter Milan.
